item.title: Winnie Harlow flaunts her incredible figure in two tiny bikinis as she poses up a storm for sizzling sunset shoot on Dubai beach
item.description: She has been a catwalk queen for four years, since her London Fashion Week debut in 2014.
item.content:encoded:
She has been a catwalk queen for four years, since her London Fashion Week debut in 2014.

And Winnie Harlow took her skills to the beach over the weekend as she posed in skimpy swimwear in the stunning surroundings of Dubai.

The Brit model - real name Chantelle Brown-Young - flaunted her incredible figure in monochrome bikinis for an Instagram shoot.

Beach life: Winnie Harlow took her catwalk skills to the beach over the weekend as she posed in skimpy swimwear in the stunning surroundings of Dubai

Winnie slipped into a sporty Tommy Hilfiger two piece for some shots, proudly displaying her long legs and taut stomach.

With her hair left loose and in curls and natural makeup, her athletic figure took the spotlight.

Walking through the surf as the sun set, Winnie also teased a look at her pert posterior in the thong-cut of her bikini bottoms as she gazed out to sea.

Check out the view! The Brit model - real name Chantelle Brown-Young - flaunted her incredible figure in monochrome bikinis for an Instagram shoot

For her other Insta shots, the top model, who has a skin condition called vitiligo, changed into an even skimpier white halterneck bikini. 

She also posed in front of the famous Burj Al Arab hotel for some shots, adding a tight white t-shirt over her bikini, knotted at the waist.

Before the beach Winnie headed to an animal sanctuary for some more shots, tenderly bottle feeding a tiger cub and deer and posing with the giraffes, alongside the caption: 'real life Disney princess'.

Stunning: The top model, who has a skin condition called vitiligo, changed into an even skimpier white halterneck bikini

What a location! She also posed in front of the famous Burj Al Arab hotel for some frames, adding a tiny white crop top over her bikini

Despite beaming in some of the beautiful photos, she chose to caption the photos with a series of cryptic messages relating to heartbreak and the search for love.

One caption included the lyrics to Brandy's song Have You Ever, with Winnie writing: 'Have you finally found the one you’ve given your heart to Only to to find that one won’t give their heart to you Have you ever closed your eyes and dreamed that they were there And all you can do is wait For the day when they will care.' 

Winnie has previously been linked to Formula 1 ace Lewis Hamilton, enjoying a sizzling summer with the fellow Brit last year. 

Strike a pose: Winnie was in a world of her own as she posed for the stunning images

Feeling blue? The top model chose to caption the photos with a series of cryptic messages relating to heartbreak and the search for love

Leggy: The Brit beauty flaunted her incredibly long legs in the gorgeous images

The model has made waves since she made her catwalk debut in September 2014 during London Fashion Week.

The catwalk queen recently gave fans a glimmer into her non-stop party girl lifestyle in an interview with Harper's Bazaar.

Sharing her best skincare tips while on the road, she told the publication: 'I like to unwind at the end of a long day with music and a massage, always. As for bed time, there's no normal time.'

Moving location! Winnie also shared some photos from an animal sanctuary earlier in the day as she tenderly bottle fed a tiger cub

Photobomb: Winnie dressed in a tiny black crop top and chic head scarf for the shots

Winnie first secured fame on the 21st season of America's Next Top Model before she carved out a successful career for herself.

She has since appeared in a number of high-profile music videos, including Eminem's Guts Over Fear and Beyoncé's Lemonade.

The 5ft 9in stunner was diagnosed with vitiligo around the age of four, which made her among one per cent of the population who has the condition. 

In her element: As she cosied up to the wildlife, the animal lover captioned this photo: 'real life Disney princess'

item.title: 'We argue all the time': Millie Bobby Brown admits there's tension with her Stranger Things co-stars following claims her team negotiated pay rise separately in top secret deal
item.description: The 14-year-old actress said they were initially all 'really nice' to one another, but now they are now like 'siblings' and constantly bicker over small things.
item.content:encoded:
Breakout star:Millie Bobby Brown at PaleyFest in LA on Sunday

Millie Bobby Brown admits the 'honeymoon stage' is over between the Stranger Things cast.

The 14-year-old actress quickly forged a close relationship with her young co-stars when they began filming the Netflix drama, and though they were initially all 'really nice' to one another, they are now like 'siblings' and constantly bicker over small things.

Speaking during a panel chat at PaleyFest on Sunday, her co-star Caleb McLaughlin, 16, said: 'Once we first met each other I think we were all very outgoing. So it was just easy to connect. It wasn't actually hard.'

Millie added: 'It was like a relationship actually, because it felt like we went through a honeymoon stage.

'We would be, like, really nice to each other. We didn't want to do anything that would hurt each other's feelings.

'Now it's so different. We are actually siblings. We argue all the time.'

But Millie admitted the arguments are over trivial matters such as 'Why are you eating my chips?'

Caleb added: 'It's little remote control arguments.'

But one person who stays out of the squabbles is Sadie Sink, who only joined the cast for the second season.

Co-stars: Gaten Matarazzo, Millie Bobby Brown, Sadie Sink, Finn Wolfhard and Caleb McLaughlin in November 

Millie admitted: 'Sadie doesn't argue though! She's like, 'Guys, everybody calm down.''

The cast will be returning to work in the next few weeks but stayed tight-lipped on what will happen in the next season of the supernatural drama.

Director Shawn Levy said: 'I'll get in so much trouble. I can't say much. But we are going back to work next month and we're super excited.'

Millie shaved her head for her role as Eleven on the show and she recently admitted it was the most 'empowering' thing she'd ever done.

She said: 'The day I shaved my head was the most empowering moment of my whole life. The last strand of hair cut off was the moment my whole face was on show and I couldn't hide behind my hair like I used to. As I looked in the mirror I realised I had one job to do. Inspire ... Shaving your head is so empowering. You don't need hair to be beautiful. You are beautiful with or without. I learnt that too x (sic)'

It recently emerged that Millie Bobby Brown's team inked a top secret payrise that was negotiated separately to her fellow young co-stars.

Hit show: The Stranger Things stars have all negotiated pay rises, but Millie's deal has been kept top secret 

Gaten Matarazzo (Dustin Henderson), Finn Wolfhard (Mike Wheeler), Caleb McLaughlin (Lucas Sinclair) and Noah Schnapp (Will Byers) are all said to be in line for around $250,000 per episode. 

Some sources have suggested Millie may be making nearer to the $350,000 fee Winona Ryder (Joyce Byers) and David Harbour (Jim Hopper) are said to be on.

According to insiders, the deals closed last week with season three production scheduled to begin on April 23.
item.dc:abstract: Millie Bobby Brown admits the 'honeymoon stage' is over between the Stranger Things cast. The 14-year-old actress quickly forged a close relationship with her young co-stars when they began filming the Netflix drama, and though they were initially all 'really nice' to one another, they are now like 'siblings' and constantly bicker over small things. Speaking during a panel chat at PaleyFest on Sunday, her co-star Caleb McLaughlin, 16, said: 'Once we first met each other I think we were all very outgoing. So it was just easy to connect. It wasn't actually hard.'
item.dc:creator: Natalie Trombetta
item.mi:shortTitle: Millie Bobby Brown admits there's tension with Stranger Things cast

item.title: Wonder in white! Star Jones stuns in sleeveless silk wedding gown as she poses with Tina Knowles after tying the knot on cruise ship
item.description: The 56-year-old television personality looked stunning in a silk wedding dress as she married Ricardo Lugo while sailing in The Bahamas on the Royal Caribbean's Anthem Of The Seas.
item.content:encoded:
Star Jones shined on her special day.

The 56-year-old television personality looked stunning in a silk wedding dress as she married Ricardo Lugo while sailing in The Bahamas on the Royal Caribbean's Anthem Of The Seas.

Star's beautiful wedding gown can be seen in all its glory in a cute Instagram snap posted by Beyonce's mom Tina Knowles on Monday morning.

The American television personality looked lovely in a sleeveless white silk mermaid dress featuring a scarf-like detailing around the neck.

Stunning: Star Jones looked fantastic in a silk white sleeveless mermaid wedding dress as she posed with husband Ricardo Lugo in this snap posted by Beyonce's mom Tina Knowles Monday

She paired the dress with a blinged out headband with matching earrings.

The shiny headwear was worn over her raven-colored tresses as she accentuated her natural looks with complimentary make-up topped off with shiny lip.

Tina, 64, also wore white including a lacy sheer long-sleeve over a matching jumpsuit. 

Ricardo kept up with the motif with a white blazer over a matching dress shirt, shiny tie, and contrasted it all with black trousers.

Seafaring nuptials: Jones, 56, tied the knot with fiance Ricardo Lugo on board a Royal Caribbean cruise ship in The Bahamas on Sunday. She posted this snap to her Instagram

It was quite the weekend for the couple as Star not only celebrated her 56th birthday on Saturday on board a cruise ship; she also got hitched Sunday.

Star exchanged vows with fiance Lugo in front of family and friends as they set sail on the Atlantic Ocean. 

Star shared several snaps to her Instagram, first of her lavish birthday party on Saturday, then her on board bachelorette party along with her pet pooch Pinky Michelle Jones.

Celebrating: The former panelist on The View also shared snaps of her bachelorette party posing with her beloved dog Pinky Michelle Jones and a glass of champagne

She also added a shot of herself and her new husband silhouetted against the sunset sky.

She wrote in the caption:  'Yesterday was my birthday...and today is our wedding day at sea! Our #AnthemToLove has officially begun on the #AnthemOfTheSeas!'

The couple, who've been dating for several years, got engaged last summer. 

Blowing out candles: She also posted to Instagram a montage of photos taken at her 56th birthday party on Saturday, also on board the ship

Lugo is an assistant state attorney who works for State Attorney Kim Foxx in Illinois, according to the Chicago Tribune. 

Guests at the nuptials included Beyonce's mom Tina Knowles-Lawson who shared a snap of some of the female guests to Instagram with the caption: 'With all my beautiful fly girls on the seas❤️ here to celebrate the love and Union of Star Jones and Ricardo.'

Star was previously married from 2004 to 2008 to Al Reynolds, a former investment banker. 

'Fly girls': Guests at the nuptials included Beyonce's mom Tina Knowles-Lawson who shared this snap of some of the female guests

Husband number 2: Ricardo, pictured with Star in New York this past October, is an attorney

The TV personality is best known for her stint on ABC's The View where she was one of the original panelists alongside Barbara Walters and Whoopi Goldberg.

She appeared on the daytime show from 1997 to 2006.

In 2011 she was cast in the fourth installment of The Celebrity Apprentice, placing fifth in the reality competition.

In November 2017, her ex-husband Reynolds came out as bisexual. 

The first husband: Star wed Al Reynolds, an investment banker, in 2004. They divorced in 2008. They're pictured at Diddy's Real White Party in The Hamptons in 2007

The American television personality looked lovely in a sleeveless white silk mermaid dress featuring a scarf-like detailing around the neck.

item.title: Tom Arnold calls ex-wife Roseanne Barr a 'Trump-loving troll' in a review of ABC's Roseanne reboot...after being fired from the original show in 1994
item.description: Tom Arnold and Roseanne Barr were married for four years before he was fired from the ABC sitcom in 1994. He wrote a review of her rebooted Roseanne show for The Hollywood Reporter.
item.content:encoded:
Tom Arnold and Roseanne Barr were married for four years before he was fired from the ABC sitcom in 1994. 

On Monday, The Hollywood Reporter released a review by the 59-year-old actor which critiqued the Roseanne reboot that airs on March 27. 

Arnold, who started as an audience 'warm-up guy,' was a writer, producer, and actor on Roseanne for more than five years.  

Op-ed: On Monday, The Hollywood Reporter released a review by the Tom Arnold which critiqued the Roseanne reboot that airs on March 27. Arnold and Roseanne were married for four years before he was fired from the ABC sitcom in 1994; seen in 1989

The reboot: Roseanne with her co-stars on the new series with John Goodman

He began by saying: 'When THR asked me to review the new Roseanne reboot, I promised objectivity. But, of course, I'd been the audience warm-up guy for the Roseanne pilot in 1988 and worked my way up on the show from writer to producer. 

'In fact, by the time Roseanne fired me in 1994 — destroying the trophy case in my office, canceling my credit cards and promising I'd never work in show business again — I'd been executive producing and playing Arnie for a few years.

'So you can see why these delightful memories would make it hard not to be prejudiced.'

Mixed reviews: According to Twitter comments, the show's ratings may very well suffer from the Trump supporter's conservative views

He then added: 'The world is different now than when Roseanne and I went to Bill Clinton’s inauguration in 1992, and a lot has changed since the show went off the air in 1997. 

'When I read on Twitter that there was going to be a Roseanne reboot, I was happy for Roseanne and the other actors, but I also knew the new show's success would rest on one thing: Who will Roseanne Conner be in 2018? Because today's Roseanne Barr is more polarizing than ever.

'No longer a feminist-pacifist voice for the working folks, she's now a far-right Trump-loving troll who's gone hard against liberals and Hillary supporters and even #MeToo women. 

Back at it: Roseanne has been rebooted for nine episodes; here is the writers room in 2018

'Roseanne Barr knew Donald Trump personally for 30 years and saw how he treated women,' he explained. 'She even did business with him. I'm not surprised by anything Trump does, but Roseanne made $200 million off Roseanne Conner, so I'm a little disappointed she doesn't have her back'; a scene from the reboot

'That is not the Roseanne Barr I knew, but that's OK so long as that's not the Roseanne Conner she brings back to TV.'

He then wrote: 'Then I read on the internet that Roseanne Conner was going to be a far-right Trump lover.

'I also read that the show would now be more about Sara Gilbert’s character, Darlene, and that Roseanne’s role wouldn’t be that big of a deal. 

'Neither change sounded that good to me, but then I remembered it's the internet, and that's where you hear all sorts of crazy stuff, like the president paying hush money to porn stars. 

In his THR review, the actor talked candidly about his termination from their marriage and the hit-TV show. 'Roseanne fired me in 1994—destroying the trophy case in my office, canceling my credit cards and promising I'd never work in show business again,' he explained

'So I accepted THR’s assignment and watched the first episode, “Twenty Years to Life,” and I discovered this: Dan is alive. Even though John Goodman's character suffered what everyone assumed was a fatal heart attack in the 1997 series finale, he and Roseanne haven't skipped a beat.'

Arnold then said it all seemed too much like the Nineties and noted Laurie Metcalfe was a 'tour de force.'   

Up the ladder: Arnold, who started as an audience 'warm-up guy,' was a writer, producer, and actor on Roseanne for more than five years. Seen in 1992

He also compliments Roseanne on her timing.

But he cautions viewers that if they want to watch a show 'because it's the voice of your political point of view, right or left,' do not watch the Roseanne reboot. 

'You'll be disappointed,' he added.

'But if you're a fan of the original Roseanne, especially the glory years — you know, the "Tom Arnold years" — this is as good as it's going to get,' he said.

He then got personal: 'Roseanne has done everything from pulling my hair transplants immediately after surgery to saying I had a 3-inch penis on SNL, so I figure if I can give the show another shot, maybe other people could too. Also, there’s Laurie F***ing Metcalf. I can face all kinds of past pain and humiliation with a smile on my face because I know Laurie Metcalf walks this earth.'

And then he ended with a big dig at his ex: 'I can also forgive Roseanne Conner voting for Trump in 2016. I bet if you're a Midwest housewife, he might've come across on TV like he really had your back. But Roseanne Barr knew Donald Trump personally for 30 years and saw how he treated women. She even did business with him. I'm not surprised by anything Trump does, but Roseanne Barr made $200 million off Roseanne Conner, so I'm a little disappointed she doesn't have her back.'

'If you're a fan of the original, especially the glory years — you know, the "Tom Arnold years" — this is as good as it's going to get,' he said as his review conclusion. Seen in 1991
item.dc:abstract: Tom Arnold and Roseanne Barr were married for four years before he was fired from the ABC sitcom in 1994. On Monday, The Hollywood Reporter released a review by the 59-year-old actor which critiqued the Roseanne reboot that airs on March 27.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Parker
item.mi:shortTitle: Tom Arnold reviews Roseanne reboot after being fired in 1994

item.title: Jamie Oliver looks strained as he steps out in London with wife Jools and their two sons... amid recent business woes with failed Barbecoa steakhouse chain
item.description: The TV chef, 42, cut a tense figure as he ran errands with his family - amid claims he has failed to pay creditors almost £7 million, after his upmarket steak restaurant crashed into administration.
item.content:encoded:
He has faced numerous business woes of late - with his steakhouse chain Barbecoa collapsing shortly after he closed several branches of his famous Italian eatery.

And Jamie Oliver showed signs of strain on Saturday as he stepped out in London with his wife Jools and their two sons, Buddy Bear, seven, and River Rocket, 19 months.

The TV chef, 42, cut a tense figure as he ran errands with his family - amid claims he has failed to pay creditors almost £7 million, after his upmarket steak restaurant crashed into administration. 

Tense: Jamie Oliver showed signs of strain on Saturday as he stepped out in London with his wife Jools and their two sons - amid his business woes regarding failed steakhouse Barbecoa

Out and about: The TV chef, 42, was seen running errands with his wife Jools and their two sons, Buddy Bear, seven, and River Rocket, 19 months (above) 

Jamie looked somewhat glum as he embarked on a day of chores in the city, clad in a casual green raincoat and jeans. 

He was first seen heading to the local shop with his young son Buddy, sweetly clasped tightly onto the seven-year-old's hand as they picked up a few essentials.

Meanwhile his wife Jools, sporting a matching ensemble, was seen joining them later on with their youngest child River, born in August 2016, and his pram in tow. 

Casual: Jamie looked somewhat glum as he embarked on a day of chores with son Buddy (R), clad in a casual green raincoat and jeans

Quality time: He was first seen clasping tightly onto the seven-year-old's hand as they picked up a few essentials from their local shop

Clearly embarking on quality time as a family, both parents were spotted laden with bags of food as they reunited at their house nearby, and headed inside with the kids. 

The couple have been married for 17 years, and also share three daughters - Poppy, 16, Daisy, fourteen, and eight-year-old Petal.

However, Jamie looked somewhat strained as he headed out for the day - following the collapse of his restaurant Barbecoa.

Tucking in: He was spotted returning home with a bag of food in hand, no doubt to enjoy a feast with his brood

Tough time: Jamie looked somewhat strained as he headed out for the day - following the collapse of his upmarket steak restaurant Barbecoa, leading to the loss of 78 jobs

The flagship Piccadilly branch of his new steakhouse chain was forced to close last month, leading to the loss of 78 jobs. 

The TV chef has since been accused of failing to pay creditors, including small businesses, some £6.7million after the upmarket eatery crashed into administration. 

Daily Fish Supplies is waiting for £34,699, and Natoora, a fresh fruit and vegetable supplier, is trying to reclaim £34,613. 

Low-key: Meanwhile his wife Jools was seen joining them later on with their youngest child River, born in August 2016, and his pram in tow

Casual: Jools sported a matching green coat and jeans as she carried their youngest in her arms

Busy bees: The pair reunited nearby, and embarked on further chores together

Discussion: They were seen chatting intently as they continued with their day

Most of the money owed by Barbecoa is to HSBC as part of its overdraft facility, but unsecured creditors include small firms. 

Barbecoa was set up by Jamie and his friend, American barbecue expert Adam Perry Lang, in 2011.

The Essex-born personality relaunched the 300-seat Piccadilly branch of Barbecoa in February 2017 and its second London outlet at St Paul's remains open - but plans for a third outlet in Victoria are believed to have been scrapped. 

The blow comes after Jamie revealed he planned to close 12 of the 37 branches of Jamie's Italian after court documents revealed the chain had debts of £71.5m. 

Business woes: Last month Jamie was forced to close the Piccadilly branch of his new steakhouse chain - and has since been accused of failing to pay creditors some £6.7million

And Jamie Oliver showed signs of strain on Saturday as he stepped out in London with his wife Jools and their two sons, Buddy Bear, seven, and River Rocket, 19 months. The TV chef, 42, cut a tense figure as he ran errands with his family - amid claims he has failed to pay creditors almost £7 million, after his upmarket steak restaurant crashed into administration.

item.title: Who bit Beyonce's face? Online frenzy follows Tiffany Haddish's shock revelation... as Chrissy Teigen tweets 'You'd NEVER guess who it is!'
item.description: While Girl's Trip star Tiffany deliberately didn't name the woman, the Bey Hive immediately began debating her identity.
item.content:encoded:
Twitter has been sent into meltdown by Tiffany Haddish's revelation that a mystery actress bit Beyonce's face at a party.

The Girl's Trip star told the April edition of GQ that the incident happened in December, at a private afterparty following Jay Z's  performance at The Forum in Los Angeles.

And while Girl's Trip star Tiffany deliberately didn't name the woman who bit Beyonce, the Bey Hive immediately began debating her identity.

Chrissy Teigen was one of the first, tweeting: 'I cannot leave this planet without knowing who bit Beyonce in the face.'

Who bit Beyonce's face? Online frenzy follows Tiffany Haddish's shock revelation... as Chrissy Teigen tweets 'You'd NEVER guess who it is!'

She then followed this up with: 'I can only think of one person who would do this. but I cannot say. but she....is the worst.'

However after finding out who the actress with vampire-like tendencies actually was, Chrissy expressed her shock.

'My initial guess was wrong. The real person? I *never* would have guessed. I’VE SAID TOO MUCH.'

But while Chrissy wasn't able to name the alleged biter, Twitter wasn't so reticent, with fans all jumping to name actresses they thought could be to blame.

Warning! Tiffany was previously called out by Beyonce in new song Top Off after the comedian spilled party drama; the two are seen in a selfie that night

The debate was started when Tiffany opened up to GQ about the memorable December party, saying the actress appeared high on drugs.

Tiffany explained: 'There was this actress there that's just, like, doing the mostest. She bit Beyonce in the face.'

As might be imagined, Beyonce wasn't happy about this. 

Continued Tiffany: 'So Beyonce stormed away, went up to Jay-Z, and was like, "Jay! Come here! This b****..." and snatched him. They went to the back of the room. I was like, "What just happened?" And Beyoncé's friend walked up and was like, "Can you believe this b**** just bit Beyonce?"'

Tiffany says that the mystery actress then crossed her path - telling her to stop dancing.

In DJ Khaled's new song Top Off, Queen Bey seemed to address her interaction with Haddish when she rapped, 'If they’re tryna party with the queen, they gon' have to sign a non-disclosure'; she is pictured with Jay Z at the bash

Tiffany then approached Beyonce, who she had met for the first time that evening.

The irrepressible 38-year-old said she told her: 'I'm going to beat somebody ass at your party. I just want to let you know that.'

Beyonce told her not to, and said of the actress: 'That b**** is on drugs. She not even drunk. The b**** is on drugs. She not like that all the time. Just chill.'

The interview updates Tiffany's previous description of meeting the superstar, in which she went into less detail.

In it Tiffany said she had witnessed the singer act possessively when the unidentified actress placed her hand on Jay Z's chest. 

In response on DJ Khaled's recent song Top Off, Queen Bey called out Tiffany, saying her name and rapping, 'If they’re tryna party with the queen, they gon' have to sign a non-disclosure.' 

But the Girls Trip star doesn't seem to be too worried that she has burned the friendship bridge with her idol. 

'Everything she said rang so real to me,' she said in a tweet after the song was released. 'Just know I will sign an NDA any day for Beyoncé. But also know this I will fight for Beyoncé. I love that woman she is a gift from God,'

Opening up: Tiffany's interview appears in the new edition of GQ, out now
item.dc:abstract: Tiffany Haddish's revelation that an actress bit Beyonce's face at a party has sent Twitter into meltdown. And while Girl's Trip star Tiffany deliberately didn't name the woman, the Bey Hive immediately began debating her identity. Chrissy Teigen was one of the first, tweeting: 'I cannot leave this planet without knowing who bit Beyonce in the face.'
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Smith
item.mi:shortTitle: Chrissy Teigen leads online frenzy to find out who bit Beyonce

item.title: Bonding with her parents! Kaia Gerber takes time off from her supermodel career to catch up with Cindy Crawford and Rande Gerber in Malibu
item.description: On Saturday she joined thousands of others in downtown Los Angeles at the March For Our Lives protest against gun violence. On Sunday, the 16-year-old was much more relaxed in Malibu.
item.content:encoded:
On Saturday she joined thousands of others in downtown Los Angeles at the March For Our Lives protest against gun violence.

And on Sunday, Kaia Gerber looked far more relaxed as she left Starbucks in Malibu with her mom, former model Cindy Crawford, her entrepreneur dad Rande Gerber and a group of gal pals.

An internationally famous model at just 16, Kaia was casually dressed in a black sweatshirt and black cargo pants that she tucked into a pair of heavy black Doc Martens boots.

Teen model and activist: Kaia Gerber was spotted out in an all-black outfit in Malibu on Sunday, the day after taking part in the March For Our Lives rally against gun violence in Los Angeles

She smoothed her brunette tresses back into a high pony tail showing off her peachy, make-up free complexion.

Kaia completed her outfit with a black bag on a chain that she threw over her shoulder.

The genetically blessed teen owes her beauty to former supermodel Cindy and her father Rande, also once a model. 

Following her parents: The 16-year-old left Starbucks with her mom Cindy Crawford, 52, and dad Rande Gerber, 55

Musical moment: The beautiful brunette's eye - and ear- was caught by a small band playing outside Starbucks

Cindy, 52, showed off her fashionista creds in a light brown suede jacket that she wore over a white T-shirt and skinny jeans that she tucked into over-the- knee black boots. 

She added more color to her ensemble with a long green, grey and white scarf she looped around her neck.

The celebrity smiled at a band playing outside Starbucks and stopped for a bit to dance along. 

Showing off her paces: The leggy lovely grooved to the music as Rande smiled at her

Not embarrassing at all: Kaia and her gal pals didn't seem to mind Cindy's performance

The Versace star walked next to her husband with her chestnut tresses tumbling over her shoulders.

Rande, who was the only one holding a Starbucks beverage, was as casually dressed as his wife of 20 years and daughter.

He donned a black zip-up jacket over a black shirt, grey pants and black sneakers.

Genetically blessed: Kaia is the image of her former supermodel mom Cindy

There was no sign of the couple's 19-year-old son Presley, who is also a model, on Sunday.

Kaia is still at high school so she was keen to support the March For Our Lives Movement.

She joined friend and fellow model Charlotte Lawrence, 17, at the rally aimed at protecting the lives of children and teachers through gun reform.

Activist pals: She joined friend and fellow model Charlotte Lawrence, 17, at Saturday's downtown L.A. rally aimed at protecting the lives of children and teachers through gun reform

And on Sunday, Kaia Gerber looked far more relaxed as she left Starbucks in Malibu with her mom, former model Cindy Crawford, her entrepreneur dad Rande Gerber and a group of gal pals. item.title: 'There are days I feel fat': Ashley Graham says women will always be self-conscious about their bodies... as she rocks out on Instagram
item.description: Ashley Graham is 'not convinced' there will ever be a time when women aren't self-conscious about their bodies.
item.content:encoded:
She posted an Instagram video of herself twerking on Monday.

But despite her incredible figure and obvious body confidence, Ashley Graham is 'not convinced' there will ever be a time when women aren't self-conscious about their bodies.

The 29-year-old model admits that she has days where she 'feels fat', and doesn't believe there will be a time when 'every woman' wakes up and 'feels like a million dollars'.

Scroll down for video 

Looking good: Ashley Graham posted an Instagram video of herself twerking on Monday

Working it: She captioned the video, which promoted her tie-in with Revlon, 'Revlon’s Kiss Plumping Lip Crème, Lemon Dance Challenge, Live Boldly'

Doubts: Despite her incredible figure and obvious body confidence, Ashley is 'not convinced' there will ever be a time when women aren't self-conscious about their bodies

She said: 'There are some days I feel fat. I'm not convinced there's going to be a moment where every woman in the world wakes up and feels like a million dollars. So, what I want to do is give women the tools that will help when those moments come up. Sometimes it can be as easy as telling yourself that you are beautiful.'

But the Sports Illustrated model refuses to 'let a little cellulite' hinder her happiness, and says she is largely inspired by the 'positive' outlook that her mother always has.

She added: 'My mom is the most positive person. She has always had a smile on her face no matter what came her way. After seeing that, I'm not going to let a little cellulite get in the way of my happiness!'

And Ashley is determined to help other women 'be happy and thrive' in their own skin, and has urged women everywhere to 'support each other'.

At her best: The Sports Illustrated model says she refuses to 'let a little cellulite' hinder her happiness, and says she is largely inspired by the 'positive' outlook that her mother always has

Speaking out: Ashley is determined to help other women 'be happy and thrive' in their own skin, and has urged women everywhere to 'support each other'

Message: She told the June/July issue of StyleWatch magazine: 'Support each other'

She told the June/July issue of StyleWatch magazine: 'Support each other. In the modelling industry, one woman is great, but in order to make a major change, you need a group of models supporting each other. At the end of the day, I just want to help other women be happy and thrive. And that's what I want for myself too.'

Meanwhile, Ashley previously admitted she was 'disgusted' by her curvaceous figure when she was a teenager.

Asked when she became accepting of her figure, Ashley explained: 'It would be so much easier to be like, 'This is the date, time, and experience I had,' but there really isn't one. It was more about experiences in my life of devaluing the fact that I was an average, normal girl living in the city.

Confident: The model is the face of Revlon; pictured at a party for the brand in January

'But being told, 'You're fat,' 'You're ugly' or 'You're just not good enough,' and trying to live in these model standards, that was my normal.

'I think I hit bottom around 18. I was disgusted with myself and told my mom I was coming home. And she told me, 'No, you're not, because you told me that this was what you wanted and I know you're supposed to do this. It doesn't matter what you think about your body, because your body is supposed to change somebody's life.'
item.dc:abstract: Ashley Graham is 'not convinced' there will ever be a time when women aren't self-conscious about their bodies. The 29-year-old model is known for speaking out about body positivity and flaunting her own stunning curves, but has admitted even she has days where she 'feels fat', and doesn't believe there will be a time when 'every woman' wakes up and 'feels like a million dollars'. She said: 'There are some days I feel fat. I'm not convinced there's going to be a moment where every woman in the world wakes up and feels like a million dollars. So, what I want to do is give women the tools that will help when those moments come up. Sometimes it can be as easy as telling yourself that you are beautiful.'
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Smith
item.mi:shortTitle: Ashley Graham rocks out on Instagram

item.title: Busty Lilly Becker puts on an eye-popping display as she slips into daring bandeau bikini during idyllic Miami trip
item.description: The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins in the daring bandeau two-piece alongside her eight-year-old son Amadeus on Miami beach.
item.content:encoded:
She has been showcasing her sensational figure while holidaying in Miami.

And Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece.

The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins and taut stomach in the daring bandeau two-piece alongside her eight-year-old son Amadeus on Miami beach. 

Bikini babe: Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece

The European beauty commanded attention along the shore in her strapless bikini top which accentuated her ample cleavage as she exited the sea following her cooling dip.

She exhibited her pert posterior in her swimwear while she walked along the sand, looking utterly relaxed. 

Make-up free Lilly donned a pair of oversized circular shades while she covered her waist-length braids with a backwards baseball cap.

Ever thew doting mother, she later playfully built sand castles with her little boy Amadeus, before they both went for a swim in the crystal clear sea.

Work it: The 41-year-old Dutch model highlighted her enviable pins and taut stomach in the daring bandeau two-piece

Seas the day: She exhibited her pert posterior in her swimwear while she walked along the sand, looking utterly relaxed

Her outing comes nine months after her husband Boris' financial woes hit the headlines in June when it was reported that he never paid back an undisclosed debt to a private bank.

In October, the 50-year-old insisted that his bankruptcy was a 'misunderstanding', explaining that he is 'in a position' to settle the bill.

Speaking to The Times, the former Tennis pro claimed that the situation arose because of a dispute over the interest he owes.

He said: 'I am in a position to settle to an amount that I owe. It's a bit like if you go to a restaurant and order a chicken sandwich and a cola and the bill is £10,000.

Fresh-faced: Lilly opted to go make-up free for the sun-soaked outing

Waist not: Lilly highlighted her narrow midriff and gym-honed figure

'I'd like to go over the bill with the restaurant owner and that chance hasn't been given to me. That's why I call this a big misunderstanding. I'm not running away. I live in the middle of London. I'm not hiding.'

There is a possibility Boris' bankruptcy could be annulled should he settle his dispute in the coming months.

In light of his woes, the German star has set his sights on reaching a resolution, which he deemed as 'important' to him.

He said: 'I would like to have an annulment. It's important to me. I could sit it out and say, "My doctor is telling me I need a holiday; my wife hasn't seen me much." Theoretically I could do that, but that is the last thing I want to do. To clarify, I want to settle the bill and move on with my life.'

No shade: Lilly donned a pair of oversized circular shades for the day

Plait's nice: She covered her waist-length braids with a backwards baseball cap

Shore thing: Her outing comes nine months after her husband Boris' financial woes hit the headlines in June when it was reported that he never paid back an undisclosed debt to a private bank

And the former Wimbledon champion explained that he takes 'full responsibility' for his financial situation but had the bank played theoretical tennis 'doubles' with him, he would have avoided his bankruptcy.

His frank interview comes after the sportsman reportedly earned in the region of £100million throughout his career, but was declared bankrupt in June over a £3.3million debt.

Speaking in an interview with Swiss newspaper, Neue Zürcher Zeitung, Mr Becker said: 'It's crazy to think I'm broke'.

'I have enough national and international deals to earn an income that will allow me to pay my staff on time and carry on my life as normal. It's true that I have been in bankruptcy since June 21, but it's wrong that I am broke.' 

Water about that: In October, the 50-year-old insisted that his bankruptcy was a 'misunderstanding', explaining that he is 'in a position' to settle the bill

Ray of light: Speaking to The Times, the former Tennis pro claimed that the situation arose because of a dispute over the interest he owes

Boris married his first wife Barbara in December 1993, with the couple going on to have Noah and Elias. 

However in the summer of 1999, while Barbara was seven months pregnant with Elias, Boris fathered his daughter Anna during a one-night-stand with Russian model Angela Ermakova at Nobu in London.

When Barbara found out about the one night stand she moved to Florida and filed for divorce.

Splish splash: Ever thew doting mother, she later playfully built sand castles with her little boy Amadeus, before they both went for a swim in the crystal clear sea

Bonding: Lilly's little boy donned a pair of red swimshorts which matched his goggles

She fought their pre-nuptial agreement and managed to win more than £14million and the custody of both sons in a divorce court.

Although Boris disputed paternity, a DNA test in February 2001 proved that he was the father and he agreed to support Anna, now a budding model, and obtained joint custody in November 2007.

After moving to Switzerland and enjoying a few years out of in the media spotlight, Becker remarried in 12 June 2009 in St Moritz, Switzerland to the Dutch model. 

Family time: She looked delighted as they spent time together
item.dc:abstract: She has been showcasing her sensational figure while holidaying in Miami. And Lilly Becker continued to flaunt her incredible curves as she soaked up the Florida sun on Monday in a head-turning crochet two-piece.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Mcloughlin
item.mi:shortTitle: Busty Lilly Becker puts on an eye-popping display in Miami

item.title: What is Stormy Daniels’s net worth?
item.description: Depending on legal ramifications, Stormy Daniels’s net worth could be changing quite a bit soon. Here's all you need to know about who she is, her net worth, 60 Minutes interview and more.
item.content:encoded:
Depending on legal ramifications, Stormy Daniels’s net worth could be changing quite a bit soon.

The former adult film actress, who allegedly had an affair with Donald Trump in 2006, recently opened up publicly about the reported affair in a 60 Minutes interview after initially denying it. 

The highly-anticipated interview came as Daniels found herself at the center of a legal storm regarding the alleged affair and a nondisclosure agreement involving hush money reportedly established on the eve of the 2016 election, with Daniels insisting that the agreement is void since Trump never personally signed it and the president’s legal team instead insisting that she has to pay $1 million (£703,660) per violation as part of the arrangement. Trump has recently fired back, insisting that reports of the affair were nothing more than 'fake news'.

But just who is Stormy Daniels? What is her net worth? Here’s all you need to know about how she’s made her money, her family, recent 60 Minutes interview and alleged relationship with Donald Trump.

Stormy Daniels gave an interview on 60 Minutes describing her alleged affair with Trump

Who is Stormy Daniels?

Stormy Daniels is an adult film actress, producer and exotic dancer who allegedly had an affair with Donald Trump back in 2006. She recently gave an interview on 60 Minutes detailing the alleged extramarital affair with the president.

Daniels was born Stephanie Clifford on March 17, 1979 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

She started exotic dancing at age 17 and later moved into acting, writing and producing in the adult film industry under the name Stormy Daniels, later making a number of media appearances in Real Sex, Dirt, and Maroon 5’s music video for their song Wake Up Call.

At the behest of fans, she also launched a short-lived campaign for the United States Senate for her home state of Louisiana in 2010 but soon dropped out.

Daniels is best-known by the public for her alleged affair with Donald Trump. They reportedly met in July 2006 at a celebrity golf tournament in Lake Tahoe and had a sexual affair while Trump was married to Melania Trump. They two reportedly kept in touch afterwards, with Trump allegedly offering her a role on his TV show Celebrity Apprentice.

Houston....you have a Stormy!

A post shared by stormydaniels (@thestormydaniels) on Mar 1, 2018 at 6:38pm PST

After staying quiet about the affair for years and denying rumors about its validity in 2011, she was reportedly paid $130,000 (£91,477) in hush money by Trump’s personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, just days before the 2016 election, as Trump was locked in a tumultuous race with former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.

News of the payoff and affair were revealed in a Wall Street Journal report on January 12, 2018. Although Daniels and Trump both initially denied the affair, Cohen later confirmed that he paid Daniels with his own money shortly before the election. Daniels soon filed a lawsuit against Trump on March 6, claiming that the private nondisclosure agreement was void since Trump never signed it. She later offered to return the money in order to speak publicly about the affair even as Trump’s lawyers insisted that she pay a $1 million (£703,660) fine per violation as part of the agreement every time she spoke publicly about it.

Daniels later conducted a much-anticipated interview on 60 Minutes on March 25, claiming that she and Trump did indeed have an affair in 2006 and that she was later threatened by someone connected to Trump after agreeing to sell her story about the alleged affair to the magazine In Touch Weekly.

How old is Stormy Daniels?

Stormy Daniels is 39 years old.

She was born on March 17, 1979.

What is Stormy Daniels’s net worth?

According to Celebrity Net Worth, Stormy Daniels’s net worth is approximately $2 million (£1.4 million).

Off to NY...in the rain! See ya tonight at Gossip in Long Island.

A post shared by stormydaniels (@thestormydaniels) on Feb 22, 2018 at 5:22am PST

How does Stormy Daniels make her money?

Daniels has made most of her money through her career in the adult entertainment industry. She began stripping at 17 years old and later started a career in the pornographic film industry, appearing in more than 180 films and producing more than 65 others. Although now retired from the adult film industry, Daniels continues to perform around the United States as an exotic dancer.

In January 2018, it was also alleged in a report by the Wall Street Journal that Daniels was paid $130,000 (£91,477) in hush money to not reveal an alleged affair with Donald Trump, who had recently married Melania Trump, that took place in 2006.

Although both Daniels and Trump initially denied the affair, she later filed a lawsuit against Trump stating that he never signed the paperwork to officially make the agreement private. The lawsuit did in fact reveal that she was paid some $130,000 (£91,477) by Trump’s lawyer, Michael Cohen. She later offered to return the hush money in March in order to speak publicly about her alleged encounters with Trump.

Who is Stormy Daniels’s husband?

Stormy Daniels’s husband is adult film producer and musician Glendon Crain. The couple have been married since 2010.

Previously, she was married to Pat Myne from 2003 to 2005 and later Mike Moz from 2007 to 2009.

DAY 68... I'm the only one left on the bus.. Rations are low, but morale is high... #cominghome

A post shared by Glendon Crain (@drummerboyglen) on Oct 7, 2017 at 9:25pm PDT

Stormy Daniels interview

On March 25, 2018, Daniels gave a highly-anticipated interview on 60 Minutes. In it, she described the alleged affair that took place between her and Donald Trump in July 2006, claiming to have had a sexual encounter with the president.

In the interview, Daniels stated that Trump said she was ‘special’ and also offered her a role on his hit TV show Celebrity Apprentice. She also stated that she ‘was never a victim’ and that her coming forward was not part of the broader #MeToo movement.

In perhaps the biggest bombshell from the interview, Daniels claimed that she was threatened in 2011 by an unknown man who told her to ‘leave Trump alone’ after she agreed to sell her story to the magazine In Touch Weekly. The man also appeared to subtly threaten Daniels after motioning to her infant daughter and stating that 'it would be a shame if something happened to her mom'. The incident left her ‘rattled’ but she declined to go to the police because she was too frightened about the ordeal.

In the explosive interview, Daniels also said that Trump told her not to worry about his wife Melania since they slept in separate rooms and that she viewed her relationship with Trump as primarily a business deal. She also said that she declined a number of ‘large paydays’ because she never wanted to ‘kiss and tell’ about the alleged affair.

Stormy Daniels and Donald Trump

According to reports, Daniels’s relationship with Donald Trump goes back to July 2006 when they met at a celebrity golf tournament in Lake Tahoe. Daniels claims that she and Trump had unprotected sex and he later promised her an appearance on Celebrity Apprentice. Daniels also claimed that Trump invited her to his office at Trump Tower in New York City and a Trump Vodka launch party event in California. She also stated that she and Trump met in 2007 about a year after their reported affair in his private bungalow in Los Angeles, to discuss the details of a possible role for her on Celebrity Apprentice.

Later, after agreeing to sell her story of the reported affair to In Touch Weekly in 2011, Daniels claimed to have been threatened by a mysterious man who was reportedly somehow linked to Trump. She subsequently denied a report on a celebrity gossip website of the alleged affair with Trump that surfaced mere months later.

On the eve of the 2016 election, Daniels was reportedly paid $130,000 (£91,477) backed by a nondisclosure agreement by Trump’s personal lawyer Michael Cohen to stay quiet about their alleged encounter, with Daniels agreeing to sign off on the arrangement out of fear for her personal safety and the safety of her family.

President Donald Trump has blasted reports of his affair with Daniels as 'so much fake news'

Later, on January 12, 2018, the Wall Street Journal broke news of the reported hush money agreement and Daniels’s alleged affair with Trump. Although Daniels and Trump both initially denied the affair, Cohen later acknowledged on February 13 that he paid Daniels hush money out of his own pocket, with Daniels’s lawyers subsequently stating that Cohen, by acknowledging the payment, was in breach of the contract and that Daniels was therefore no longer bound by it.

On March 6, Daniels filed a lawsuit against Trump claiming that he had never signed the paperwork in order to make the arrangement private, with the lawsuit revealing that she was indeed paid by Trump’s lawyer. She later offered to return the money in order to speak publicly about her affair with Trump.
item.dc:abstract: Depending on legal ramifications, Stormy Daniels’s net worth could be changing quite a bit soon. The former adult film actress, who allegedly had an affair with Donald Trump in 2006, recently opened up publicly about the affair in a 60 Minutes interview after initially denying it. The highly-anticipated interview came as Daniels found herself at the center of a legal storm regarding the alleged affair and a nondisclosure agreement involving hush money reportedly established on the eve of the 2016 election.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Quigley
item.mi:shortTitle: What is Stormy Daniels’s net worth?

item.title: 'Here's to many more adventures together!' Reese Witherspoon sends 'wonderful husband' Jim Toth her love on their seventh wedding anniversary
item.description: They tied the knot in a private ceremony at her Libbey Ranch in Ojai, California, on March 26, 2011. The actress has since sold the property but her love for her husband is still going strong.
item.content:encoded:
They tied the knot in a private ceremony at her Libbey Ranch in Ojai, California, on March 26, 2011.

Reese Witherspoon has since sold the property but her love for husband Jim Toth is still going strong.

On Monday the couple celebrated their seventh wedding anniversary and the 42-year-old Big Little Lies star posted a snap of them standing on a runway in the heart of the country with a light aircraft and rolling hills in the background.

Out in the wild: Reese Witherspoon posted this snap on Monday captioned, 'Happy Anniversary to my wonderful husband who keeps me smiling everyday! Here’s to many more adventures together! I love you, JT' referring to Jim Toth

She captioned it: 'Happy Anniversary to my wonderful husband who keeps me smiling everyday! Here’s to many more adventures together! I love you, JT.'

Jim, 47, towered over Reese who went for a country and western look in a taupe cowboy hat, a blue blouse, skinny jeans and cowboy boots.

He is co-head of motion picture talent at the Creative Artists Agency, where Reese is a client.

Jim sported a red and blue plaid shirt, black pants, brown shoes and a big smile.

Dressy couple: The 42-year-old Big Little Lies star and her Creative Artists Agency husband, 47, looked smart as they headed to an event in February

The couple didn't give any indication of where they were, but it seemed very remote, suggesting they wanted some alone time on their anniversary.

There was no sign of their five-year-old son, Tennessee, or Reese's daughter Ava, 18, and Deacon, 14, whom she shares with ex-husband, actor Ryan Phillippe, 43.

The break may be just what Reese needs as she has a busy year ahead of her.

 The Draper James clothing and lifestyle entrepreneur has just released magical mystery A Wrinkle In Time, co-starring Oprah Winfrey and Mindy Kaling,

He wants a slice: Reese and Jim's five-year-old son, Tennessee, was very interested in his mom's birthday cake. The actress turned 42 on Thursday

The whole family: Reese with Ava, Deacon, little Tennessee and husband Jim at the Sing premiere in Decmeber 2016

She also has comedy drama, Wish list, in the works along with Tinker Bell, a live-action take on Peter Pan's fairy friend. Both have yet to set release dates.

Reese is working on the second series of her HBO show Big Little Lies with Nicole Kiman and Shailene Woodley.

Plus she has TV series Little Fires Everywhere and an untitled TV project with Jennifer Anison in pre-production that gives a behind-the-scenes look at a morning TV show broadcast from New York.

Fairy tale fun: Reese and Storm Reid in family friendly A Wrinkle In Time

Reese has since sold the property but her love for husband Jim Toth is still going strong. On Monday the couple celebrated their seventh wedding anniversary and the 42-year-old Big Little Lies star posted a snap of them standing on a runway in the heart of the country with a light aircraft and rolling hills in the background.

item.title: 'Nothing in Christianity says I can't be a rock star!' Alice Cooper on how his faith saved him from an early death
item.description: The 70-year-old rocker was warned by doctors to quit drinking or die 37 years ago, when he woke up throwing up blood and was taken to hospital.
item.content:encoded:
Alice Cooper credits his religion for saving him from alcoholism.

The 70-year-old rocker was warned by doctors to quit drinking or die 37 years ago, when he woke up throwing up blood and was taken to hospital.

He recalled: 'Everything that could go wrong was shutting down inside of me.

'I was drinking with Jim Morrison and Jimi Hendrix and trying to keep up with Keith Moon and they all died at 27.'

'Nothing in Christianity says I can't be a rock star!' Alice Cooper on how his faith saved him from an early death; he is pictured last month

And the Welcome to My Nightmare rocker - who has children Calico, Dash and Sonora with wife Sheryl Goddard - admits it took his brush with death to bring him back to the church.

He told the New York Daily News newspaper's Confidential column: 'My wife and I are both Christian. My father was a pastor, my grandfather was an evangelist. I grew up in the church, went as far away as I could from it - almost died - and then came back to the church.'

The shock rocker insists his faith is compatible with his career.

He said: 'There's nothing in Christianity that says I can't be a rock star. People have a very warped view of Christianity. They think it's all very precise and we never do wrong and we're praying all day and we're right-wing. It has nothing to do with that. It has to do with a one-on-one relationship with Jesus Christ.'

As he was: Cooper in 1970 onstage

The 'School's Out' hitmaker finds the time for Bible study every day and goes to church every Sunday, and is proud that none of his children have ever had problems with drugs or alcohol.

Meanwhile, Alice can be seen as King Herod in the live action version of 'Jesus Christ Superstar' alongside John Legend in the lead role on NBC next weekend.

And the musician has taken inspiration from late actor Alan Rickman for his performance.

He explained: 'When I first heard about it, I thought Alan Rickman -- that condescending sort of arrogant character, and I kind of fashioned what I would do after what I thought Alan Rickman would do if he were alive.'

The 70-year-old rocker was warned by doctors to quit drinking or die 37 years ago, when he woke up throwing up blood and was taken to hospital. He recalled: 'Everything that could go wrong was shutting down inside of me.

item.title: PICTURED: Country star Maren Morris wears stunning keyhole white mini dress as she marries Ryan Hurd in charming Nashville ceremony
item.description: The pair said 'I Do' on Saturday. Before they wed, the singer bared her soul with fans, saying: 'Writing vows, feeling sentimental AF and dreaming of this guy being my freaking husband in a few days.'
item.content:encoded:
Country favorite Maren Morris and love Ryan Hurd said 'I do' this weekend.

The couple tied the knot in an intimate Nashville, Tennessee ceremony Saturday night, according to People.

The petite crooner looked lovely in a white minidress that had a keyhole front exposing her chest. She added a long train that attached to her waist and silver platform heels.

They have wed: Country favorite Maren Morris and love Ryan Hurd said 'I do' this weekend. The couple tied the knot in an intimate Nashville, Tennessee ceremony Saturday night, according to People

The dress had a halter neckline and a jeweled belt that stood out. And the red carpet favorite wore her highlighted locks down to her shoulders. 

The My Church singer shared a sweet kissing photo to Instagram with the caption, 'My last turn home.'

He also shared a kissing photo to Instagram and his caption had their wedding date. 

Man and wife: The petite crooner looked lovely in a white minidress that had a keyhole front exposing her chest. She added a long train that attached to her waist and silver platform heels

Before their nuptials, the The Middle songstress, 27, bared her soul to fans while writing her vows.

She wrote on Instagram: 'Writing vows, feeling sentimental AF and dreaming of this guy being my freaking husband in a few days.'

 

The pair chose Nashville because it was the place they first met and sparked a connection, while co-writing music for Tim McGraw in 2013.

Together all the time: Here they are seen arm in arm at the Grammy Awards in New York City in January

Before Saturday's nuptials, they shared their 'Rehearsal Dinner Vibes' on Instagram stories, sharing a shapshot of Morris dazzling in white while wearing striking jewel-toned eyes.

She also gave her makeup artist Moani Lee a shout out in a solo photo of her stunning beauty look. 

Maren and Ryan engaged in July and announced the exciting news on Instagram, where the songstress was happy to show off her dazzling uncut diamond ring. 

Music City is meaningful! The pair chose Nashville because it was the place they first while co-writing music for Tim McGraw in 2013

Beautiful bride: Before Saturday's nuptials, they shared 'Rehearsal Dinner Vibes' on Instagram stories, posting photos of Morris dazzling in white and with striking jewel-toned eyes

She said 'Yes!' Maren and Ryan engaged in July and announced the exciting news on Instagram, where the songstress was happy to show off her dazzling uncut diamond ring

'I know what she likes and I had somebody in Canada put it together. The stone is from New York City, it’s from an uncut diamond, and then the rest of it’s cast just custom for her,' Hurd shared with Entertainment Tonight after popping the question.   

He made sure it was something 100% unique for his love, explaining: 'I couldn’t just buy something. I had to make it something that fit her.'

In addition to giving her a ring to remember, Hurd dedicated himself to his love in song.

He released the song Diamonds Or Twine, which was written for Maren, just prior to their engagement last summer. 

Just for her: Before popping the question, Ryan made sure he found a ring that was perfect for her, explaining: 'I couldn’t just buy something. I had to make it something that fit her'

True love: In addition to giving her a ring to remember, Hurd dedicated himself to his love in song, releasing the tune Diamonds Or Twine before getting on one knee

Morris and Hurd were friends and collaborators long before they began dating. 

The Seeing Blind songstress explained to People last July: 'We had been friends, but there was always this writing chemistry in the room, and eventually, the timing of it was undeniable,'

'We had such a foundation built off writing so many songs over the years that we were like, "Why are we avoiding this?"'

Meant to be: Morris and Hurd (above in January) were friends and collaborators long before they began dating, with the Seeing Blind songstress saying: 'We had been friends, but there was always this writing chemistry in the room, and eventually, the timing of it was undeniable'
item.dc:abstract: The pair said 'I Do' on Saturday night. Before their nuptials, the singer bared her soul to fans via Instagram, telling them: 'Writing vows, feeling sentimental AF and dreaming of this guy being my freaking husband in a few days' in the caption to a post.

item.title: 'We'll see how many he wants!' Kate Hudson reveals she'd love to have a baby girl as she talks family plans with beau Danny Fujikawa
item.description: Kate Hudson, 38, has insisted she 'isn't done yet' when it comes to children, gushing she'd love to have a baby girl one day.
item.content:encoded:
She's a doting mum to two boys, Ryder, 14, and Bing, six.

But Kate Hudson, 38, has insisted she 'isn't done yet' when it comes to children, gushing she'd love to have a baby girl one day.

Talking to The Times the Almost Famous actress said it's ultimately down to her boyfriend Danny Fujikawa if and when she expands her brood.

Family plans: Kate Hudson, 38, has insisted she 'isn't done yet' when it comes to children, gushing she'd love to have a baby girl one day

The actress is already a proud mum to Ryder, with ex-husband Chris Robinson, and Bingham, with former fiance Matt Bellamy of the band Muse. 

'I'd like to [have more children]! I'm not done yet. A girl would be fun,' she gushes in the new interview, quickly adding though: 'We'll see. We'll see how many Danny wants.'

The How To Lose a Guy in 10 Day' actress was 24 when she had her first child and admits that makes her feel different to her friends as they're only just starting their families now, though she has no regrets.

Besotted: Talking to The Times the Almost Famous actress said it's ultimately down to her boyfriend Danny Fujikawa if and when she expands her brood

Mum of two: The actress is already a proud mum to Ryder, with ex-husband Chris Robinson, and Bingham, with former fiance Matt Bellamy of the band Muse

She explained: 'I've only ever been a mom! I never had an adult life without kids. My friends had their whole twenties -- they're all just getting pregnant now. But everything I've experienced has been great, albeit not conventional, including my childhood.'

With her own acting background and her sons' fathers being musicians, Kate, who is the daughter of Hollywood icon Goldie Hawn, is not surprised that both her sons seem destined to be performers when they grow up.

She said: 'Oh, yeah! I definitely believe it's in the DNA. It's just what you know, it's in your gut and you just pursue it.

With her boys: The actress was 24 when she had her first child and admits that makes her feel different to her friends as they're only just starting their families now

'[Ryder is] a great mimic. I wouldn't be surprised -- I'd be a little concerned, but in a good way -- if he went into stand-up. And Bing is abnormally musical. He's been drumming since he was a year and a half.'

Though her work sometimes keeps her apart from her children, the 'Fool's Gold' actress is thankful technology keeps them in touch - though it isn't always convenient.

She said: 'It's funny with FaceTime now -- you're always still with your kids all day, even when you're travelling. Last night I kept getting calls about homework. I was, like, 'Honey, I'm trying to get to sleep!' '

 Serious: Kate and Danny recently celebrated their one-year anniversary, and rumours had even began to circulate that they had got engaged following the romantic occasion

Kate and Danny recently celebrated their one-year anniversary, and rumours had even began to circulate that they had got engaged following the romantic occasion. 

Last year, on December 3, Kate marked the couple's anniversary with a gushing note on Instagram describing how they first met when she was 23 and pregnant. 

The Almost Famous star began: 'The first time I met Danny I was 23 and enormously pregnant with Ryder. His step sisters are my best friends @sarafoster @erinfoster and so it goes we have been in the same circle for over a decade!'

She added: 'A year ago today Danny took me on a hike and what I thought was just a hike with a family friend turned very quickly into an unexpected first date.

'No moves were made on this first date. In fact, it took months for him to make a first move! And as a kiss on this bridge would have been nice, the kiss a year later was so much sweeter.'

Hudson then remarked: 'So on our 15th year of knowing each other we were able to open our hearts to each other to feel so much pure love and it’s been truly incredible.! ❤️Happy first date anniversary baby. #LoveThisMan #WhatAYear.' 

Slow burner: Last year, on December 3, Kate marked the couple's anniversary with a gushing note on Instagram describing how they first met when she was 23 and pregnant
item.dc:abstract: Kate Hudson, 38, has insisted she 'isn't done yet' when it comes to children, gushing she'd love to have a baby girl one day. Talking to The Times, the Almost Famous actress said it's ultimately down to her boyfriend Danny Fujikawa if and when she expands her brood. The actress is already a proud mum to Ryder, with ex-husband Chris Robinson, and Bingham, with former fiance Matt Bellamy of the band Muse.

item.title: Beach baby! Pregnant Eva Longoria covers her growing bump in chic floral dress during seaside outing with husband Jose Baston
item.description: She's expecting her first baby in May. And Eva Longoria looked happy and healthy as she was spotted enjoying a day at the beach in Miami on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
She's expecting her first baby in May.

And Eva Longoria looked happy and healthy as she was spotted enjoying a day at the beach in Miami on Monday.

The 43-year-old stunner covered her growing baby bump in a breezy chic floral dress as she wrapped her arms around husband Jose Baston.

Oh baby! Eva Longoria, 42, was spotted enjoying a day at the beach in Miami on Monday

Daring to impress, the Desperate Housewives star showcased her delicate decolletage in the flower print number that had a plunging neckline.

Her toned and tanned arms were on full display as the sleeveless gown covered her enviable figure in a complimentary manner.

She kept her trademark brunette tresses long and loose under an exquisite fedora that featured a black strap.

Adding to the springtime casual look, Eva rocked large gold hoop earrings and a pair of retro sunglasses.

Chic stunner: The stunner covered her growing baby bump in a breezy chic floral dress

Impressive: Daring to impress, the Desperate Housewives star showcased her delicate decolletage in the flower print number that had a plunging neckline

Toned up: Her toned and tanned arms were on full display as the sleeveless gown covered her enviable figure in a complimentary manner

Throwing caution to the wind, the natural stunner went virtually makeup free with just a dab of pale pink lip.

After enjoying the sandy shoreline, Eva wrapped her arms around Jose as they found a place to lounge together on the crowded beach.

The TV mogul revealed his trim athletic build as he took off his black shirt to relax next to his expecting wife. 

Hair story: She kept her trademark brunette tresses long and loose under an exquisite fedora that featured a black strap

Additions: Adding to the springtime casual look, Eva rocked large gold hoop earrings and a pair of retro sunglasses

Windy city: She grabbed her hat as the wind picked up

Throwing caution to the wind, the natural stunner went virtually makeup free with just a dab of pale pink lip

They left the popular tourist location arm in arm as he carried most of the beach accessories they had brought.

With her first baby on the way in a matter of weeks, Eva doesn't appear to be slowing down any time soon as she attended the filming of her new ABC soap Grand Hotel earlier in the day.

While the multi-talented actress is busy with her thriving career, Eva recently spilled to Entertainment Tonight she was so busy she sometimes forgot she was pregnant.

Loved up: After enjoying the sandy shoreline, Eva wrapped her arms around Jose Baston as they found a place to lounge together on the crowded beach

Quitting time: They left the popular tourist location arm in arm as he carried most of the beach accessories they had brought

Toes in sand: They both carried their flip flops in their hands

Leggy stud: Jose showcased his muscular calves as he walked the beach

'I have been working, so sometimes I wake up and I forget I am pregnant. Like this morning, I was like, "Oh my god, I am late!" and then I was like, "Why can't I get out of bed?" and I was like, "Helppp!" 

'And then I was like, "Oh yeah, this thing." ... [I said] we should go skiing next weekend and [Jose] said no. I didn't know why. 

'I was like, "Why can't we go? What is the problem?" And I was like, "Oh god, I forgot!"'

Eva and her media mogul husband confirmed her pregnancy in January after rumours began circling at the end of last year, when she posted a photo of her growing baby bump on her Instagram account.

The couple tied the knot in Mexico in May 2016. 

Take it off: The TV mogul revealed his trim athletic build as he took off his black shirt to relax next to his expecting wife

Treasure chest: Jose revealed his hirsute chest to gawking onlookers

Hats off! Eva took off her hat as she found shade underneath the umbrella

Phone check: Eva had to check in on her phone as she is a busy actress, director, and producer
item.dc:abstract: She's expecting her first baby in May. And Eva Longoria looked happy and healthy as she was spotted enjoying a day at the beach in Miami on Monday. The 43-year-old stunner covered her grwoing baby bump in a breezy chic floral dress as she wrapped her arms around husband Jose Baston.

item.title: American Idol: Katy Perry munches her way through auditions and admits to having 'snacks under the desk'
item.description: The 33-year-old singer munched her way though Sunday's episode of American Idol, slurping on noodles, gobbling fruit, and even getting a pizza delivered to her judging table.
item.content:encoded:
Katy Perry munched her way though Sunday's episode of American Idol, slurping on noodles, gobbling fruit, and even getting a pizza delivered to her judging table.

'I have snacks under the desk, I love to eat, I love to snack…I love chicken nuggets,' said the 33-year-old singer, who revealed her beloved dog Nugget looks like a chicken nugget.

The Roar singer was not seen sharing her snacks with her fellow judges, 68-year-old R&B legend Lionel Richie and 41-year-old country star Luke Bryan, but she had plenty of enthusiasm for the contestants after her cravings were satisfied.

Snack time: Katy Perry admitted to a snacking habit during Sunday's episode of American Idol on ABC

One of the most interesting performers of the night was Adam Sanders, who completed during season 12 of the show, when he was 19-years-old.

The Texan had been attacked on social media since the appearance, for his 'weight and sexuality'. 

Some trolls had even told him to commit suicide.

'I let it get to me in the wrong way, it killed me inside,' said the 24-year-old, who works in a seafood restaurant and at a drag club.

Insatiable appetite: The pop star was shown munching throughout auditions

Various foods: Katy was shown eating snacks from a bag and a salad

Little nugget: The Teenage Dream singer said she loves chicken nuggets and said her beloved dog Nugget looks like one

Pizza break: A contestant pleased Katy when she walked up with a hot pizza for her

Adam appeared reborn as Ada Vox, in full drag regalia, to sing House Of The Rising Sun.

'You are owning your talent, you are owning who you are,' praised Lionel, as Katy ran in circles jubilantly.

Ada was sent to Hollywood, after receiving oodles of adoration from the panel.

Triumphant return: Adam Sanders auditioned on season 12 and made the top 50

Full drag: The singer returned in full drag regalia as Ada Vox

First time: Katy pulled up a photo from the singer's first audition

The first person to hit the stage was 17-year-old 'daddy's girl' Gabby Barrett from Pennsylvania.

She sang Good Girl by Carrie Underwood.

The judges thought her 'nasal-y' rendition was a bit too gimmicky.

Country singer: Gabby Barrett struggled with country songs but  found her voice with a church song

She tried a church song instead that pleased them more.

'You were just on fire,' said Lionel as she was voted in.

Katy 'punked' Gabby's dad, pretending she hadn't made it, which led to tears and laughter.

Good times: Katy helped pull a prank on Gabby's supportive father

Golden ticket: Gabby held up her golden ticket to Hollywood as her father beamed

'I hate it when dads cry,' wailed the Dark Horse songstress.

Flamboyant 22-year-old Caitlin Lucia did a version of Katy's I Kissed a Girl, with acoustic guitar.

'I think she might have sung it better,' Katy told her fellow judges.

Hit song: Caitlin Lucia sang Katy's song I Kissed A Girl

Nailed it: Katy told Caitlin that she might have sung it better

Caitlin, a Californian waitress, was voted into the next round.

Elvis' distant cousin, 28-year-old Amelia Presley, did Heartbreak Hotel.

'I think Elvis would be proud,' Luke told the Texan singer.

Next was Elvis impersonator/country lover Drake Milligan, who did George Strait's You Look So Good In Love.

Elvis fan: Drake Milligan advanced after the former Elvis impersonator performed a country song

'I'm fired up now,' Luke told the 19-year-old Texan, who received a golden ticket.

Mylon Shamble, a 24-year-old 'barbershop bartender', did Stand By Me, by Ben E. King.

'That's the best Stand By Me I've ever heard,' Katy told the excited Floridian.

Best version: Mylon Shamble impressed with her version of Stand By Me

North Carolina lady Lee Vasi was keen to impress Lionel.

The 20-year-old got a warm serenading of Zoom from the music legend, which she joined enthusiastically.

'You learned from the old-school up, you've been educated,' Lionel told her.

Soul song: Lionel Richie sang his song Zoom with Lee Vasi

Special moment: Lee was thrilled to sing along with Lionel

The retail associate was less successful with Toni Braxton's Love Shoulda Brought You Home.

'Your pitch went out of line,' commented Lionel.

'You're so close to being the complete package,' added Luke.

The judges took a chance with Lee, and she was sent to Hollywood.

Next round: The judges took a chance on Lee and sent her to Hollywood

In Los Angeles, they received some 'real characters' including Tory N. Teasley, a 26-year-old music teacher who did the explicit version of Cee Lo Green's Forget You.

Then, Lucy Clearwater, a 19-year-old Californian, dedicated Sir Mix-a-Lot's Baby Got Back to Luke.

Jarom Eubanks, a 20-year-old fast food worker from Utah, turned up in his PJs.

Nice try: Jarom Eubanks showed up in his pajamas and was sent home

He warbled through R.E.M.'s Losing My Religion, getting a 'no' from everyone except Katy.

'You're absolutely weird and I'm totally weird…you're cool bro,' she consoled.

Philadelphia bowling alley attendant Michael J. Woodward did Ed Sheeran's Make It Rain.

Killed it: Michael J. Woodward did Ed Sheeran's Make It Rain

'It's really refreshing to see this,' Lionel told the lovable 20-year-old, who has no formal singing experience.

'Beautiful soul,' he added as Michael took his golden ticket.

Brielle Rathbun, an 18-year-old Tennessean choreographer, coached Luke with some 'hip thrusts'

Teen talent: Brielle Rathbun coached Luke with some dance moves

Hip thrust: Luke learned a new hip thrust from Brielle

She did Sara Bareilles' Gravity, and was sent to Hollywood.

'I really like what you're doing,' Lionel told Brielle, who has a large collection of adopted and biological siblings.

Carly Moffa said: 'I would definitely describe myself as a mess.'

Quirky star: Carly Moffa described herself as 'a mess' but she sang beautifully

The 25-year-old did an original song, which she wrote while her mother was going though a tough time with Primary Progressive MS.

'Vocal quality is amazing, personality is amazing,' praised Lionel, who adored the quirky New Jersey resident.

Carly was sent to Hollywood.

Amazing gal: The judges praised Carly for her voice and personality

Ayana 'Rose' Lawson has been homeless in Illinois for almost five years, while she works at the Navy Pier in Chicago.

'I've always kept a smile on my face,' said the talented 22-year-old, who played guitar beautifully while she sang Bonnie Raitt's I Can't Make You Love Me.

'Your voice is good, and it's only going to get better,' said Luke, while Katy advised her to 'develop a little bit more' then come back.

Always smiling: Ayana 'Rose' Lawson failed to advance after her story of being homeless endeared her to the judges

'The hardest thing as a judge, is telling these kids no,' said Katy tearfully.

Flamoyant Harlem resident Samuel Swanson used to work on a farm in Alabama.

The 28-year-old did Al Green's Let's Stay Together, and gained a golden ticket.

Alabama roots: Samuel Swanson belted out Let's Stay Together and advanced

'Velvet, velvet and then layered with silky velvet,' sighed Luke, as Lionel compared him to his 'good friend' Luther Vandross.

Connecticut 'heavy metal rocker' Damiano Scarfi, who is unemployed, screeched through More Than a Feeling.

'You may have to branch off from that 80s stuff,' Luke told the 19-year-old, who didn't make the cut.

Rock singer: Damiano Scarfi failed to advance after his screeching take on More Than A Feeling

Colorado-based hostess Jurnee (no second name) met her wife Ashley at a party.

'It means everything to me to make her proud,' said the 18-year-old, who sang Rise Up by Andra Day.

'Jurnee, don't stop believing,' joked Luke, as the teen was sent to Hollywood.

American Idol continues on Monday on ABC.

Teen talent: Jurnee sang Rise Up by Andra Day

Moving on: The Colorado singer celebrated after getting her golden ticket to Hollywood

'I have snacks under the desk, I love to eat, I love to snack…I love chicken nuggets,' said the 33-year-old singer, who revealed her beloved dog Nugget looks like a chicken nugget. The Roar singer was not seen sharing her snacks with her fellow judges, 68-year-old R&B legend Lionel Richie and 41-year-old country star Luke Bryan, but she had plenty of enthusiasm for the contestants after her cravings were satisfied.
